topic.title: Using the Review Functionality with an External CMS

body.p: In addition to its core content management capabilities, includes integrated review functionality. If you are working with content stored in an external CMS (Content Management System), you can also create review tasks using files from that system, provided the external CMS has a connector for Oxygen XML Editor/Author.
body.note: External CMS platforms often provide customized versions of Oxygen, so some of the methods described below may not be available or may work differently depending on your environment.

section.title: Uploading a Review Task
section.p: To create a review task using files from an external CMS, you have several options:

ul.li: Open the file in the editor and use the Add File to Review Task action from the contextual menu.
For DITA resources, open the map in the DITA Maps Manager view and use the Add File to Review Task action from the contextual menu. You can also drag map entries and drop them in the New Task box.
If available in your customized version of Oxygen, drag resources from the Data Source Explorer view and drop them in the New Task box.
If you have a special view for exploring the server that contains documents on your CMS, you can also drag resources from that view and drop them in the New Task box.

section.title: Specifying the Root DITA Map
section.p: If you choose to add the files to the task from DITA Maps Manager, the root map that is specified in the DITA Maps Manager is automatically added as the Context DITA Map. Otherwise, if you work with DITA projects, you should manually add the root DITA map to the task.

section.title: Getting the Changes
section.p:
To retrieve the changes made by reviewers and save them in the CMS, follow these steps:
Click the Get Changes link in the task box. The merge tool is displayed.
Merge the changes from the remote files with the current version of the files. The files are automatically opened in the editor as modified with all the changes applied.
Save the files using the specific procedure for your CMS.
